title: Postdoctoral Fellow - Vijay Krishna Lab - Cleveland Clinic Careers
author: Nbowman
cleaned_text: Lab Cleveland, OH, US Postdoctoral Research Fellow position is available in the laboratory of Dr. Vijay Krishna at the Lerner Research Institute, Cleveland Clinic to interrogate photon-drug interactions with theoretical and computational chemistry for different healthcare solutions. The successful candidate will join a multidisciplinary team of investigators for design and evaluation of novel drug and nanomaterials for prevention and treatment of diseases. Specifically, the position will focus on developing computational models for different drug candidates using high performance computers and quantum computers and validating with experimental studies. This position will include collaborations as well as exchange visits with external partners (IBM and Algorithmiq). Candidates should have Ph.D. in theoretical chemistry, physics or materials science. Successful candidates should have demonstrated expertise in studying photon-molecule interactions using computational chemistry. Special consideration will be given to applicants with additional expertise in developing algorithms for quantum computers. Prospective candidates must be creative, self-motivated and capable of working independently. Candidates must be proficient in both spoken and written communication in English. Candidates will be expected to independently design studies, statistically analyze data and write manuscripts and reports. Principal Investigator: Vijay Krishna, PhD Lerner Research Institute Department: Biomedical Engineering Lab Research Topics: - Theoretical/ computational chemistry - Photon-drug interactions - Nanomaterials - For more information about the lab's research, please contact Dr. Vijay Krishna at [krishnv2@ccf.org](mailto:krishnv2@ccf.org) Job Responsibilities: - Independent project design with the goal of data generation, analysis, interpretation and manuscript preparation - Develop quantum chemistry framework for drugs - Work with multidiscplinary collaborators - Lab and project management Education: - PhD or MD/PhD required - MD with relevant laboratory experience may substitute for PhD Languages: - English Proficiency proof required for candidates arriving on J-1, J-2, or F1 + OPT visa status Work Experience: - Previous experience in a research or academic setting. Graduate student experience meets this requirement. - Scientific writing experience Additional Preferred Qualities: - Physical and theoretical chemistry - Light-material interactions - Quantum computer Physical Requirements: - Ability to perform work in a stationary position for extended periods - Ability to operate a computer and other office equipment - Ability to communicate and exchange accurate information - Ability to distinguish color - Manual dexterity to handle specimens and repair equipment - Ability to lift and transport equipment or specimens weighing up to 20 pounds - May be exposed to hazardous chemicals, bio-hazards, radioactive materials, etc. Personal Protective Equipment: - PPE per institutional requirements; may vary by laboratory Preferred Application Materials: All application materials should be submitted directly via email to Dr. Vijay Krishna ( [krishnv2@ccf.org](mailto:krishnv2@ccf.org)). - CV - Research statement - List of referees Keywords: Postdoc, Research, LRI Pay Range Minimum hourly: $0.01 Maximum hourly: $333,340.26 The pay range displayed on this job posting reflects the anticipated range for new hires.
